sense.gloss: to stir, to churn, to poke (a fire), to disturb (water)
to rummage around
to throw into confusion, to throw into chaos, to disturb
to scratch
to perspire
to shovel, to paddle
stroke (swimming), arm stroke
adds strength or emphasis to verbs
snow shoveling (shovelling), snow clearing, snow removal
snow shovel, snow plow, snow plough
shaved ice (usually served with flavored simple syrup), Italian ice, snow cone, sno-cone
mixed vegetable and seafood tempura
useless resistance, vain struggle
to snatch (and run), to carry off, to swipe, to nab
to scoop up (and remove; sand, earth, etc.)
to struggle, to writhe, to wriggle, to squirm
to act frantically, to make desperate efforts
to scratch, to claw
being frustrated because something is not quite as hoped (just as one cannot scratch an itch from outside a shoe), having an itch that one cannot scratch
to perspire, to sweat
dog paddle (swimming style), doggy paddle
to pull together with the hands, to adjust (e.g. one's collar), to arrange
to bolt down (food), to gulp down, to shovel (into one's mouth)
to carry under the arm
to rake in, to rake towards one
to gather up, to scrape up together, to rake
to strum (an instrument), to thrum, to pluck
to disturb, to upset, to ruffle, to stir up, to mess up
to stir up, to poke (the fire), to beat (an egg)
to arouse (interest, feelings, etc.), to stir, to stoke, to whip up, to fan, to kindle, to stimulate
to tear off, to pluck, to scratch off
itch, itching
busiest and most profitable business period, peak season
to mix, to stir, to scramble, to churn
sweating easily, profuse sweater
to rummage through, to ransack (e.g. a drawer)
to throw into confusion, to disrupt, to upset, to meddle in
to sum up, to summarize, to summarise
to haul in hand over hand
pilfering, snatching, swiping, filching
pilferer, (petty) thief, (bag) snatcher
egg soup
poker, fire iron used to rake ash

sdata.j: ↑窮地↑↓きゅうち↓から↑足掻↑↓あが↓き↑出↑↓で↓る。
sdata.e: He will wriggle out of the fix.

sdata.j: もっと↑単刀直入↑↓たんとうちょくにゅう↓に↑言↑↓い↓ってくれないかな。↑隔靴掻痒↑↓かっかそうよう↓の↑感↑↓かん↓なきにしもあらずだよ。
sdata.e: You don't have to leave me hanging like this. Why don't you just come out and tell it to me straight?

sdata.j: トムが↑授業↑↓じゅぎょう↓↑中↑↓ちゅう↓にいびきを↑掻↑↓か↓いているのが↑聞↑↓き↓こえました。
sdata.e: I heard Tom snoring during the class.

sdata.j: その↑社会↑↓しゃかい↓↑学者↑↓がくしゃ↓は↑背中↑↓せなか↓を↑掻↑↓か↓く↑癖↑↓くせ↓がある。
sdata.e: The sociologist has a habit of scratching his back.

sdata.j: ↑借金↑↓しゃっきん↓で↑足掻↑↓あが↓きがとれない。
sdata.e: He is up to his ears in debt.

sdata.j: ↑足掻↑↓あが↓きがとれない。
sdata.e: She is struggling helplessly.

sdata.j: ↑虫↑↓むし↓に↑噛↑↓か↓まれたところを↑掻↑↓か↓いてはいけない。
sdata.e: You should try not to scratch your insect bites.

sdata.j: ↑猫↑↓ねこ↓は↑私↑↓わたし↓の↑手↑↓て↓を↑引↑↓ひ↓っ↑掻↑↓か↓いた。
sdata.e: The cat scratched my hand.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓の↑絶↑↓た↓え↑間↑↓ま↓ない↑侮辱↑↓ぶじょく↓が↑彼女↑↓かのじょ↓の↑怒↑↓いか↓りを↑掻↑↓か↓き↑立↑↓た↓てた。
sdata.e: His constant insults aroused her anger.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓は↑人↑↓ひと↓ごみを↑掻↑↓か↓き↑分↑↓わ↓けて↑走↑↓はし↓ってくるのを↑彼女↑↓かのじょ↓はちらりと↑見↑↓み↓た。
sdata.e: She glimpsed him running through the crowd.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓は↑頭↑↓あたま↓を↑掻↑↓か↓く↑癖↑↓くせ↓がある。
sdata.e: He has the habit of scratching his head.

sdata.j: ↑彼↑↓かれ↓は↑背中↑↓せなか↓を↑掻↑↓か↓いたり、↑爪↑↓つめ↓を↑噛↑↓か↓んだりする↑癖↑↓くせ↓がある。
sdata.e: He has a habit of scratching his back and biting his nails.

sdata.j: いつ↑寝首↑↓ねくび↓を↑掻↑↓か↓かれるかわかったものではありません。
sdata.e: There's no telling when she'll stab you in the back.

sdata.j: ↑熊↑↓くま↓は↑木↑↓き↓の↑皮↑↓かわ↓で↑背中↑↓せなか↓を↑掻↑↓か↓く↑習性↑↓しゅうせい↓がある。
sdata.e: Bears often scratch their backs on the bark of trees.

sdata.j: ↑彼女↑↓かのじょ↓は↑頭↑↓あたま↓を↑掻↑↓か↓いた。
sdata.e: She scratched her head.

sdata.j: トムは↑急↑↓いそ↓いでシリアルを↑掻↑↓か↓き↑込↑↓こ↓んだ。
sdata.e: Tom scarfed down his cereal in a hurry.

sdata.j: この↑程↑↓ほど↓よい↑辛↑↓から↓さが、↑食欲↑↓しょくよく↓を↑掻↑↓か↓き↑立↑↓た↓てる。
sdata.e: This has moderate spiciness but arouses appetite.

sdata.j: この↑程↑↓ほど↓よい↑辛↑↓から↓さが、↑食欲↑↓しょくよく↓を↑掻↑↓か↓き↑立↑↓た↓てる。
sdata.e: This is moderately spicy but arouses appetite.

sdata.j: この↑程↑↓ほど↓よい↑辛↑↓から↓さが、↑食欲↑↓しょくよく↓を↑掻↑↓か↓き↑立↑↓た↓てる。
sdata.e: This has moderate spiciness but is appetite-stimulating.

sdata.j: この↑程↑↓ほど↓よい↑辛↑↓から↓さが、↑食欲↑↓しょくよく↓を↑掻↑↓か↓き↑立↑↓た↓てる。
sdata.e: This is moderately spicy but appetite-stimulating.

sdata.j: この↑程↑↓ほど↓よい↑辛↑↓から↓さが、↑食欲↑↓しょくよく↓を↑掻↑↓か↓き↑立↑↓た↓てる。
sdata.e: This has moderate spiciness but stimulates the appetite.

sdata.j: この↑程↑↓ほど↓よい↑辛↑↓から↓さが、↑食欲↑↓しょくよく↓を↑掻↑↓か↓き↑立↑↓た↓てる。
sdata.e: This is moderately spicy but stimulates the appetite.

sdata.j: この↑程↑↓ほど↓よい↑辛↑↓から↓さが、↑食欲↑↓しょくよく↓を↑掻↑↓か↓き↑立↑↓た↓てる。
sdata.e: This is moderately spicy, but it does stimulate the appetite.

sdata.j: この↑程↑↓ほど↓よい↑辛↑↓から↓さが、↑食欲↑↓しょくよく↓を↑掻↑↓か↓き↑立↑↓た↓てる。
sdata.e: This is moderately spicy, but it does get your juices flowing.

sdata.j: この↑程↑↓ほど↓よい↑辛↑↓から↓さが、↑食欲↑↓しょくよく↓を↑掻↑↓か↓き↑立↑↓た↓てる。
sdata.e: Though this is only moderately spicy, it does make your mouth water.

sdata.j: トムは↑孫↑↓まご↓の↑手↑↓て↓で↑背中↑↓せなか↓をボリボリ↑掻↑↓か↓いた。
sdata.e: Tom scratched his back with a backscratcher.

sdata.j: ↑日本↑↓にほん↓の↑孫↑↓まご↓の↑手↑↓て↓で↑背中↑↓せなか↓を↑掻↑↓か↓いてみたことってある？
sdata.e: Have you ever scratched your back with a backscratcher made in Japan?

sdata.j: これは↑私↑↓わたし↓の↑好奇↑↓こうき↓↑心↑↓しん↓を↑掻↑↓か↓き↑立↑↓た↓てる。
sdata.e: This arouses my curiosity.
